selectedVerses.text: Some of the men of Manasseh deserted to David when he came with the Philistines for the battle against Saul. (Yet he did not help them, for the rulers of the Philistines took counsel and sent him away, saying, "At peril to our heads he will desert to his master Saul.")
We get our bread at the peril of our lives, because of the sword in the wilderness.
He delivered us from such a deadly peril, and he will deliver us. On him we have set our hope that he will deliver us again.
